content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I used the `list_files` command to see the files in the current directory and found a file named `brno_reservoir_trail_info.py`. I opened the file and found that it contains information about the trail, including its length, difficulty level, and other important details.
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "read_file", "args": {"filename": "potential_hiking_trails.txt"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command read_file returned: 1. Brno Reservoir Trail
2. Moravian Karst
3. Pálava Hills
4. Jeseníky Mountains
5. Krkonoše National Park
6. Šumava National Park', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "google", "args": {"query": "Brno Reservoir Trail Moravian Karst P\u00e1lava Hills Jesen\u00edky Mountains Krkono\u0161e National Park \u0160umava National Park"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command google returned: ["http://www.cski-cr.cz/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/RaOP_proceedings_2015.pdf", "https://www.toulejse.cz/en/tips-for-trips", "https://botzool.sci.muni.cz/verejnost/botanical-excursions-in-moravia.pdf", "https://www.toulejse.cz/en/tips-for-trips/natural-attractions", "https://wikitravel.org/wiki/en/index.php?title=Czech_Republic&mobileaction=toggle_view_desktop", "https://padkos.co/best-places-to-visit-in-the-czech-republic-for-nature-lovers/", "https://www.geonika.cz/mgr/articles/MGR_Volume_07_Issue_2_full.pdf", "https://www.casopis.ochranaprirody.cz/res/archive/080/009487.pdf"]', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "browse_website", "args": {"url": "https://www.alltrails.com/", "question": "Brno Reservoir Trail Moravian Karst P\u00e1lava Hills Jesen\u00edky Mountains Krkono\u0161e National Park \u0160umava National Park"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: an advertisement for the AllTrails app, which provides information on various hiking trails around the world, including several in the Czech Republic such as the Brno Reservoir Trail, Moravian Karst, Pálava Hills, Jeseníky Mountains, Krkonoše National Park, and Šumava National Park. The app offers features such as verified trails, offline maps, and wrong-turn alerts, and also promotes environmental initiatives such as Leave No Trace and One Tree Planted.

Links: ['AllTrails (https://www.alltrails.com/?ref=header)', 'Explore (https://www.alltrails.com/explore?ref=header)', 'Community (https://www.alltrails.com/community?ref=header)', 'Saved (https://www.alltrails.com/members/slug/favorites?ref=header)', 'Shop (https://www.alltrails.com/)']", type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_shell", "args": {"command_line": "pip install alltrails"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:
b''
STDERR:
b'ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement alltrails (from versions: none)\nERROR: No matching distribution found for alltrails\n\n[notice] A new release of pip is available: 23.0.1 -> 23.1.2\n[notice] To update, run: pip install --upgrade pip\n'", type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "google", "args": {"query": "how to install alltrails python package"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command google returned: ["https://www.alltrails.com/careers", "https://support.alltrails.com/hc/en-us/articles/360018931092-Can-I-combine-multiple-routes-that-are-on-the-same-map-", "https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/california/batiquitos-lagoon-trail", "https://github.com/microsoft/nni/issues/4805", "https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/arkansas/athens-big-fork-trail/photos", "https://askubuntu.com/questions/1242702/how-to-remove-python-2-from-ubuntu-20-04", "https://www.linkedin.com/in/jasonbedney", "https://pt.linkedin.com/company/alltrails/?trk=organization-update_share-update_actor-text"]', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "browse_website", "args": {"url": "https://www.alltrails.com/", "question": "How do I install the alltrails Python package?"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: an advertisement for the AllTrails app, which provides information on hiking trails and outdoor activities. It offers features such as verified trails, offline maps, and wrong-turn alerts. The app also has a paid subscription service called AllTrails+ that offers additional planning features. The text does not provide information on how to install the AllTrails Python package.

Links: ['AllTrails (https://www.alltrails.com/?ref=header)', 'Explore (https://www.alltrails.com/explore?ref=header)', 'Community (https://www.alltrails.com/community?ref=header)', 'Saved (https://www.alltrails.com/members/slug/favorites?ref=header)', 'Shop (https://www.alltrails.com/)']", type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "web_search", "args": {"query": "how to install alltrails python package"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command web_search returned: [
    {
        "title": "Installing Packages — Python Packaging User Guide",
        "href": "https://packaging.python.org/tutorials/installing-packages/",
        "body": "Requirements files Installing from VCS Installing from other Indexes Installing from a local src tree Installing from local archives Installing from other sources Installing Prereleases Installing \"Extras\" Requirements for Installing Packages ¶ This section describes the steps to follow before installing other Python packages."
    },
    {
        "title": "Installing packages using pip and virtual environments - Python",
        "href": "https://packaging.python.org/guides/installing-using-pip-and-virtual-environments/",
        "body": "It's used to install and update packages. You'll need to make sure you have the latest version of pip installed. Unix/macOS Debian and most other distributions include a python-pip package; if you want to use the Linux distribution-provided versions of pip, see Installing pip/setuptools/wheel with Linux Package Managers."
    },
    {
        "title": "python - How to install packages offline? - Stack Overflow",
        "href": "https://stackoverflow.com/questions/11091623/how-to-install-packages-offline",
        "body": "Mar 13, 2013 at 21:42 Add a comment 13 Answers Sorted by: 470 On the system that has access to internet The pip download command lets you download packages without installing them: pip download -r requirements.txt (In previous versions of pip, this was spelled pip install --download -r requirements.txt .)"
    },
    {
        "title": "Installing Python Modules — Python 3.11.4 documentation",
        "href": "https://docs.python.org/3/installing/index.html",
        "body": "The following command will install the latest version of a module and its dependencies from the Python Package Index: python -m pip install SomePackage Note For POSIX users (including macOS and Linux users), the examples in this guide assume the use of a virtual environment."
    },
    {
        "title": "Installing and Managing Python Packages - PyCharm Guide - JetBrains",
        "href": "https://www.jetbrains.com/pycharm/guide/tutorials/getting-started-pycharm/installing-and-managing-python-packages/",
        "body": "Installing and Managing Python Packages How to work with Python packages in your project. In the previous step, we set up a Python interpreter for our project. But sometimes our project depends on Python packages and getting those setup can be tricky. Package Tool Window"
    },
    {
        "title": "Is there a way to install all python modules at once using pip?",
        "href": "https://stackoverflow.com/questions/38962947/is-there-a-way-to-install-all-python-modules-at-once-using-pip",
        "body": "1 @SimonKlaver I am working on this new project that might want me to install different modules at different times and I don't know right now what modules I might need. So I just want to install every module out there so that I don't have to install them when I actually have to use them. - rsnaveen Aug 15, 2016 at 21:01 1"
    },
    {
        "title": "Packaging Python Projects — Python Packaging User Guide",
        "href": "https://packaging.python.org/en/latest/tutorials/packaging-projects/",
        "body": "This tutorial walks you through how to package a simple Python project. It will show you how to add the necessary files and structure to create the package, how to build the package, and how to upload it to the Python Package Index (PyPI). Tip"
    },
    {
        "title": "Is there a way to automatically install required packages in Python ...",
        "href": "https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48314010/is-there-a-way-to-automatically-install-required-packages-in-python",
        "body": "1) File a bug with PyCharm -- they are really on top of it. 2) Since PyCharm creates a virtual environment for you, all you need to do is run it from the virtual environment in the terminal. You don't need to reinstall anything. - SteveJ Jan 18, 2018 at 5:08"
    }
]', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_shell", "args": {"command_line": "pip install --upgrade pip"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:
b'Requirement already satisfied: pip in /usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages (23.0.1)\nCollecting pip\n  Downloading pip-23.1.2-py3-none-any.whl (2.1 MB)\n     \xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81\xe2\x94\x81 2.1/2.1 MB 7.8 MB/s eta 0:00:00\nInstalling collected packages: pip\n  Attempting uninstall: pip\n    Found existing installation: pip 23.0.1\n    Uninstalling pip-23.0.1:\n      Successfully uninstalled pip-23.0.1\nSuccessfully installed pip-23.1.2\n'
STDERR:
b"WARNING: Running pip as the 'root' user can result in broken permissions and conflicting behaviour with the system package manager. It is recommended to use a virtual environment instead: https://pip.pypa.io/warnings/venv\n"', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_shell", "args": {"command_line": "pip install alltrails"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:
b''
STDERR:
b'ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement alltrails (from versions: none)\nERROR: No matching distribution found for alltrails\n'", type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "web_search", "args": {"query": "how to install alltrails python package"}}}', type='ai_response')]
"""
